alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Union County; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 03 at 1:30PM MST until February 04 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: .While wind chills will be abnormally cold for these lower elevation zones, wind chills will also be dangerously cold through the northern mountains. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Central Highlands, Estancia Valley, Guadalupe County, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Santa Fe Metro Area, Upper Rio Grande Valley, Far Northeast Highlands, Northeast Highlands and Union County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 9 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Union County; Upper Rio Grande Valley
